text: On tap at brewery, poured a goldish color with aromas of tropical fruit, light pineapple, and some malt. Flavors are a tropical hop head paridise where a slight malt flavor comes through. This beer is way too crushable and the hop mix is just enough where it doesnt ruin your palate and you begin to thirst for more of it after each sip. A solid beer in this series.
Draft. Hazy gold. Little white head/some lace. Aroma of dank grass/citrus. Taste is lightly bitter, cracker, citrus. Palate is soft, a bit thin, light bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 Tap at proof. Clear straw yellow with fluffy white head. Big citrus and floral hop aroma. Grainy with lots of floral bitterness. Reminds me a lot of like a light ballast point sculpin. Dry Hoppy flavorful and low in alcohol. I hope they make more of this!

Draft at Proof. Deep golden pour with a bubbly white head. Fruity tropical hops, pineapples and peaches in the nose with yeasty notes and slightly sweet backing. Flavor has a lot of tropical fruitiness as well and a yeasty and malt backing. So easy drinking and delicious.

Draft at the source - Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is oranges, tangerines and grapefruit. Tastes of oranges, tangerines and grapefruit with a bitter backend and some resin. Solid!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of bitter pine and citrus with slight malt notes. Taste is grapefruit and pine with a slight malt backbone that is destroyed by the hops. Light and crisp, crazy drinkable with a ton of flavor. Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft at Funky Buddha Brewery. Nice hoppy character mixed with slight citrus and floral aromas. Very typical to this style. No frills but tasty for sure.
Cloudy gold. White head. Nice hops, light yeasty flavors, caramel, hint of pears.
Another great one. Slight hazt gold. Aroma is citrus. Taste is hoppy. A little bitter a little tart. Sticky mouth feel.

Cigar City Seans Hoppy Session Ale is a an easy drinking pale with a nice bit if uniqueness. Aroma is peppery with a bit of floral. Pour is amber clear with a lasting head. A pleasant peppery (but not hot) hop flavor dominates the flavor but doesnt last as long on the palate as I would like. It works, though, because the sessionable quality makes it easy drinking. Seans Hoppy Session Ale is another well-executed beer from CCB.

A hazed golden ale with a thin creamy off white head. In aroma, biscuit malt over grassy piney hops, orange pulp, very nice. In mouth, nice grassy malt with piney and lightly citrusy hops, pungent yet quaffable.

Tap at CCB. It pours clear gold with a small white head. The nose is grass, pine, pithy, lemon peel, light soap, varnish and sweet apple. The taste is earth, toast, hay, grass, earth, pithy lemon, grapefruit, peppery notes and varnish with a dry, bitter finish. Smooth and easy drinking. A bit like a kernel apa....

On tap at Cigar City Brewery, Tampa. Pours a golden yellow pour with no head. Nose is citrus, predominantly lime and hoppy. Taste is lemon lime with some mild bitterness, and light. Finish is dry and light. Quaff score 6 / 10

On tap at Cigar City Taproom. Pours a golden yellow with a white head and aroma of hops and citrus. Taste is of hops and citrus while light with a short, slight bitter finish. Light but enjoyable and drinkable and has more taste and hops then the ABV suggests

Pours a clear gold on tap with bubbly white head that leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is super happy, fresh citrus and a slight bready grain back. Taste follows, so incredibly happy for the abv, Im impressed. Very nice, I could see drinking these all day long.

These Torcedores Series brews are just getting better and better. It smelled pretty damn close to a Christmas tree. The body wasnt as pine-filled as the aroma, but rather full of grapefruit, grassy hops and a nice tangerine finish. Loving this one!

On tap at CCB. Aroma is big citrus hop with a ton of grapefruit behind a grainy malt note. Body is orange-ish colored. Flavor is similar with big hops upfront and a light caramel and grain/triscuit finish. Very dry finish. Perfect for Florida.
